description: Integrate your applications with the Pylon API to manage users, contacts, issues, and knowledge base articles seamlessly. Access and manipulate Pylon data through a comprehensive set of tools designed for efficient workflow automation. Enhance your productivity by leveraging this server to interact with Pylon's platform programmatically.

tools.name: pylon_get_me
tools.description: Get current user information from Pylon. Returns your user profile including name, email, role, and permissions. Use this to verify your authentication and see what access level you have.

tools.name: pylon_get_contacts
tools.description: Get customer contacts from Pylon. Use this to find customers who have submitted support tickets or inquiries. Returns contact details like name, email, company, and contact history.

limit.description: Maximum number of contacts to return (1-100). Default is 20. Example: 50

search.description: Search contacts by name, email, or company. Examples: "john@example.com", "Acme Corp", "John Smith"

tools.name: pylon_create_contact
tools.description: Create a new customer contact in Pylon. Use this when adding a new customer who will submit support requests or access your customer portal.

name.description: Full name of the contact. Example: "Sarah Johnson"

email.description: Contact email address. Must be valid email format. Example: "sarah@company.com"

portal_role.description: Role in customer portal: "admin", "member", "viewer". Determines access level. Example: "member"

tools.name: pylon_get_issues
tools.description: Get support issues/tickets from Pylon. Returns a list of customer support requests with details like title, status, priority, and assigned team member. Use this to see your workload or find specific issues.

limit.description: Maximum number of issues to return (1-100). Default is 50. Example: 25

status.description: Filter by issue status. Options: "open", "in_progress", "pending", "resolved", "closed". Example: "open"

assignee.description: Filter by assigned team member. Use email or user ID. Examples: "john@support.com", "user_123"

tools.name: pylon_create_issue
tools.description: Create a new support issue/ticket in Pylon. Use this to log customer problems, bug reports, or feature requests that need to be tracked and resolved.

title.description: Brief title describing the issue. Examples: "Login page not loading", "Cannot upload files", "Billing question"

status.description: Initial status: "open", "in_progress", "pending", "resolved", "closed". Usually "open" for new issues. Example: "open"

assignee.description: Team member to assign (optional). Use email or user ID. Example: "support@company.com"

description.description: Detailed description of the issue, including steps to reproduce and impact. Example: "User reports that clicking login button shows error message. Affects all Chrome users on Windows."

tools.name: pylon_get_knowledge_bases
tools.description: Get all knowledge bases from Pylon. Knowledge bases contain help articles, FAQs, and documentation that customers can access. Returns list of available knowledge bases with their names and article counts.

tools.name: pylon_get_knowledge_base_articles
tools.description: Get help articles from a specific knowledge base. Use this to find existing documentation that might help resolve customer issues or to see what self-service content is available.

knowledge_base_id.description: ID of the knowledge base to get articles from. Get this from pylon_get_knowledge_bases first. Example: "kb_123abc"

tools.name: pylon_create_knowledge_base_article
tools.description: Create a new help article in a knowledge base. Use this to add new documentation, FAQs, or troubleshooting guides that customers can access for self-service support.

title.description: Article title that clearly describes the topic. Examples: "How to Reset Your Password", "Troubleshooting Login Issues", "Billing FAQ"

content.description:
Full article content in markdown or HTML format. Include step-by-step instructions, screenshots, and links. Example: "## Steps to Reset Password
1. Go to login page
2. Click Forgot Password..."

knowledge_base_id.description: ID of the knowledge base to add article to. Example: "kb_123abc"

tools.name: pylon_get_teams
tools.description: Get all support teams from Pylon. Teams are groups of support agents that handle different types of issues (e.g., Technical, Billing, Sales). Returns team names, member counts, and specializations.

tools.name: pylon_get_team
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific support team. Returns team members, their roles, current workload, and team performance metrics.

team_id.description: ID of the team to get details for. Get this from pylon_get_teams first. Example: "team_456def"

tools.name: pylon_create_team
tools.description: Create a new support team in Pylon. Use this to organize support agents into specialized groups for handling different types of customer issues (e.g., Technical Support, Billing, Enterprise accounts).

name.description: Team name that describes their specialization. Examples: "Technical Support", "Billing Team", "Enterprise Support", "Level 2 Support"

members.description: Array of user IDs or emails of team members. Example: ["john@company.com", "user_123", "sarah@company.com"]

description.description: Description of team responsibilities and expertise. Example: "Handles complex technical issues, API questions, and integration support"

tools.name: pylon_get_accounts
tools.description: Get all customer accounts from Pylon. Accounts represent companies or organizations that use your service. Returns account details like company name, subscription level, and contact information.

tools.name: pylon_get_account
tools.description: Get detailed information about a specific customer account. Returns company details, subscription info, billing status, and associated contacts and issues.

account_id.description: ID of the account to get details for. Get this from pylon_get_accounts or customer records. Example: "acc_789xyz"

tools.name: pylon_search_users
tools.description: Search for team members and support agents in Pylon. Use this to find colleagues by name, email, or department when assigning issues or checking availability.

query.description: Search term to find users by name, email, or department. Examples: "john", "support@company.com", "technical team"

tools.name: pylon_get_users
tools.description: Get all team members and support agents in your Pylon workspace. Returns user profiles including names, roles, teams, and availability status.

tools.name: pylon_search_contacts
tools.description: Search for customer contacts in Pylon by name, email, company, or other details. Use this to quickly find a specific customer when you need to view their information or create an issue for them.

query.description: Search term to find contacts. Can search by name, email, company, or phone. Examples: "alice@example.com", "Acme Corporation", "John Smith", "+1-555-0123"

tools.name: pylon_search_issues
tools.description: Search for support issues/tickets in Pylon by keywords, customer name, or issue content. Use this to find related issues, check for duplicates, or research similar problems.

query.description: Search term to find issues. Can search in titles, descriptions, and customer names. Examples: "login error", "billing question", "API timeout", "John Smith"

filters.description: Additional filters as key-value pairs. Examples: {"status": "open", "priority": "high"}, {"assignee": "john@company.com", "created_after": "2024-01-01"}

tools.name: pylon_get_issue
tools.description: Get complete details of a specific support issue/ticket. Returns full issue information including title, description, status, priority, assignee, customer info, and conversation history.

issue_id.description: ID of the issue to retrieve. Get this from pylon_get_issues or pylon_search_issues. Example: "issue_abc123"

tools.name: pylon_update_issue
tools.description: Update an existing support issue/ticket. Use this to change status (e.g., mark as resolved), reassign to different team members, update priority, or modify details as you work on the issue.

title.description: New title for the issue. Example: "RESOLVED: Login page not loading"

assignee.description: New assignee email or user ID. Example: "tech-lead@company.com"

issue_id.description: ID of the issue to update. Example: "issue_abc123"

description.description: Updated description with new information or resolution details. Example: "Fixed CSS conflict causing login button to not render properly."

tools.name: pylon_snooze_issue
tools.description: Temporarily hide an issue until a future date/time. Use this for issues that cannot be worked on now but need follow-up later (e.g., waiting for customer response, scheduled maintenance, feature release).

until.description: Date and time when issue should reappear (ISO 8601 format). Examples: "2024-01-15T09:00:00Z" (specific date/time), "2024-01-20T00:00:00Z" (beginning of day)

issue_id.description: ID of the issue to snooze. Example: "issue_abc123"

tools.name: pylon_get_issue_messages
tools.description: Get the conversation history for a specific support issue. Returns all messages between customer and support team, including timestamps and sender information. Use this to understand the context and progress of an issue.

issue_id.description: ID of the issue to get messages for. Example: "issue_abc123"

tools.name: pylon_create_issue_message
tools.description: Add a new message/reply to a support issue conversation. Use this to respond to customers, add internal notes, or provide updates on issue progress.

content.description: Message text to send. Can include formatting and links. Examples: "Hi John, I've escalated this to our dev team. You should see a fix by tomorrow.", "**Internal note:** This appears to be related to the server migration last week."

issue_id.description: ID of the issue to add message to. Example: "issue_abc123"

tools.name: pylon_get_tags
tools.description: Get all available tags for categorizing issues and contacts. Tags help organize and filter support tickets by topic, urgency, or type (e.g., "bug", "feature-request", "billing", "urgent").

tools.name: pylon_create_tag
tools.description: Create a new tag for categorizing issues and contacts. Use this to add new categories that help organize and filter your support tickets effectively.

name.description: Tag name that describes the category. Examples: "billing-question", "feature-request", "bug-report", "urgent", "enterprise-customer"

color.description: Color for the tag in hex format or color name. Examples: "#FF0000", "red", "#00AA00", "blue"

tools.name: pylon_get_ticket_forms
tools.description: Get all ticket submission forms available to customers. Forms define what information customers provide when creating new support requests (e.g., bug report form, billing inquiry form).

tools.name: pylon_create_ticket_form
tools.description: Create a new ticket submission form for customers. Use this to customize what information customers provide when creating different types of support requests (bug reports, feature requests, billing questions).

name.description: Form name that describes its purpose. Examples: "Bug Report Form", "Billing Inquiry", "Feature Request", "Technical Support"

fields.description: Array of form field objects defining what information to collect. Example: [{"type": "text", "name": "summary", "required": true}, {"type": "textarea", "name": "steps_to_reproduce"}, {"type": "select", "name": "browser", "options": ["Chrome", "Firefox", "Safari"]}]

description.description: Description shown to customers explaining when to use this form. Example: "Use this form to report bugs or technical issues with our software."

tools.name: pylon_get_webhooks
tools.description: Get all configured webhooks in Pylon. Webhooks automatically send notifications to external systems when events occur (e.g., new issues created, status changes, messages added).

tools.name: pylon_create_webhook
tools.description: Create a new webhook to automatically notify external systems when events occur in Pylon. Use this to integrate with Slack, Discord, email systems, or custom applications.

url.description: HTTPS URL where webhook payloads will be sent. Must be publicly accessible. Examples: "https://hooks.slack.com/services/...", "https://api.myapp.com/webhooks/pylon"

active.description: Whether webhook should start active immediately. Default is true. Example: true

events.description: Array of events to trigger webhook. Examples: ["issue.created", "issue.updated", "issue.resolved"], ["message.created"], ["contact.created", "team.assigned"]

tools.name: pylon_delete_webhook
tools.description: Delete an existing webhook to stop sending notifications to an external system. Use this when removing integrations or cleaning up unused webhooks.

webhook_id.description: ID of the webhook to delete. Get this from pylon_get_webhooks. Example: "webhook_xyz789"

pylonApiToken.description: The API key for the Pylon MCP server.
